content:
TITLE: Using LM Studio Client for LLM Interaction in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import the LMStudioClient, create an instance, load a model, and use it to generate a response to a given prompt. It showcases the basic usage of the SDK for interacting with LLMs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/publish/sdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { LMStudioClient } from "@lmstudio/sdk";
const client = new LMStudioClient();

const model = await client.llm.model("llama-3.2-1b-instruct");
const result = await model.respond("What is the meaning of life?");

console.info(result.content);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using LM Studio SDK for LLM Interaction in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import the LMStudioClient, initialize a client, load a model, and generate a response to a prompt. This example showcases the basic usage of the SDK for interacting with a local LLM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { LMStudioClient } from "@lmstudio/sdk";
const client = new LMStudioClient();

const model = await client.llm.model("llama-3.2-1b-instruct");
const result = await model.respond("What is the meaning of life?");

console.info(result.content);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing LM Studio SDK using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the LM Studio SDK package using npm and saves it as a dependency in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/publish/sdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @lmstudio/sdk --save
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing LM Studio SDK via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the LM Studio SDK package using npm. This is a prerequisite for using the SDK in your project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @lmstudio/sdk --save
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing LM Studio CLI using NPX
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the LM Studio setup tool which installs the CLI version (lms). This uses npx to run the installation script without requiring a separate installation step.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/publish/lmstudio/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx lmstudio install-cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building LM Studio JavaScript SDK Locally
DESCRIPTION: This set of bash commands shows how to clone the lmstudio-js repository, navigate to the project directory, install dependencies, and build the project locally. It's useful for contributors who want to work on the SDK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/publish/sdk/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js.git --recursive
cd lmstudio-js
npm install
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building LM Studio SDK Locally
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to clone the repository, install dependencies, and build the project locally. This is useful for contributors who want to work on the SDK itself.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js.git --recursive
cd lmstudio-js
npm install
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting LM Studio Local Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the LM Studio local server, which is necessary for interacting with LM Studio in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript-empty/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
lms server start
```

----------------------------------------

```

```

TITLE: Starting LM Studio Local Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the LM Studio local server, which is required for interacting with LM Studio in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-javascript-empty/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

TITLE: Running Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the project in development mode using npm
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development environment for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript-preprocessor/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Node.js Project for Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Node.js project for development purposes. The source code is located in the src/ directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-javascript/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: start
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Node.js Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server for the Node.js project. This runs the source code located in the src/ directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-javascript-empty/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: start
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Node.js Project in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Node.js project for development purposes. This runs the code from the src/ directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript-empty/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to compile TypeScript code to JavaScript for production deployment
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to compile TypeScript code to JavaScript for production use, outputting to the 'dist/' directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript-preprocessor/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Node.js Project for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to compile the TypeScript code to JavaScript for production. This process transforms code from the src/ directory to the dist/ directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/lmstudio-ai/lmstudio-js/blob/main/scaffolds/node-typescript-empty/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```
